msItem.title: Padshah-namah.
msItem.note: Folio one, recto: Presented to the Royal Asiatic Society by Abraham Welland Esq through Graves C. Haughton Esq. June 1830. Folio one, verso, in margin, seemingly authentic autograph note of Shah Jahan: Jild-i awwal-i Padshah-namah-i in niyazmand-i dargah-i bi-niyaz. Harrarahu Shihab al-Din Muhammad Sahib-qiran-i thani Shah Jahan Badshah-i Ghazi. A history of the reign of Shah Jahan. Vol. I. Containing preface and an account of his ancestors and of the first ten years of his reign. Illuminated initial opening. Ruled margins. Red headings and punctuation.
msItem.incipit: Nigarin kalami kih guzarish-i an daman-i sami'a-ra

condition.p: A manuscript of high quality, which has suffered some damage, though most of the text survives. Margins and other parts of many damaged pages have been carefully repaired.

bindingDesc.p: Blue leather binding with tooled decoration. (Carnegie U.K. Trust grant, 1929 - see front flyleaf 4 recto.)

availability.p: Visitors are welcome to consult manuscripts in the library by prior appointment. Information on access is available on the library page of the Society's web site at www.royalasiaticsociety.org and appointments can be arranged by e-mailing library@royalasiaticsociety.org

list.item: History of India. Mughal period. Shah Jahan.
